Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: This double-blind, randomised controlled trial included 50 patients undergoing primary THA at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital from April 2019 to December 2021.

Participants.evidence: Participants were aged 18–85 years, ASA Physical Status 1–3.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised 1:1 to receive either TXA (10 mg/kg) or placebo (0.9% sodium chloride).

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized no difference in fibrinolysis and blood loss between TXA and placebo.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was fibrinolysis, defined as maximum lysis (ML) >15% within 1 hour, measured by rotational thromboelastometry (ROTEM).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation used a permuted block design, with allocation concealed by opaque envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, surgeons, and assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This double-blind, randomised controlled trial included 50 patients undergoing primary THA at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital from April 2019 to December 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 22 patients received TXA and 25 received placebo.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences in clinical outcomes, including blood loss and coagulation profiles, were observed.

Harms.evidence: Two thrombotic events occurred in the placebo group.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Department of Anesthesiology, Thomas Jefferson University Hospital.
